Package com.px100systems.data.plugin.persistence

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    PersistenceProvider
    On-disk persistence provider for in-memory data grids responsible for data loading, write-thropugh and write-behind.

    Databases should be either in-process (H2 or MapDB) or at the very least local (MySQL, Oracle, etc.) to minimize network traffic.

    Any SQL or NoSQL provider should translate the passed unit name (which contains tenant ID) into a physical table of DB file name aka "storage"
    according to its configuration: typically a set of wildcarded/regex mappings of unit names to table/file names.
    PersistenceProvider.Connection
    Only relevant for NoSQL (MapDB, etc.) providers.
    PersistenceProvider.LoadCallback  
    UnitStorageMapper
    Unit name to storage name mapping interface.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    DiskPersistence
    Persistence server aka "persister".

    All servers are independent and access the cluster simultaneously.
    Not every in-memory cluster member would have a collocated persistence server.
    Persisters are tenant-agnostic: they save everything in the cluster to the persistent database, so those databases can be synchronized later.
    PersistenceLogEntry
    Transaction record - tells write-behind persistence servers what to do.
    PersistenceLogEntry.PersistenceLogRecord  
    RegexUnitStorageMapper
    Unit name to storage name mapping via regular expressions.
  • Exception Summary 
    Exception Description
    PersistenceProviderException
    On-disk persistence provider exception.
    Generally recoverable - the caller should pause operations for some period and then resume assuming the database has been restarted.
